intro: Bidens richardsiae, commonly known as the richardsia tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow flowers with ray florets and a central disk, typical of the genus Bidens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Bidens richardsiae is also known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain habitats.
